slug: /221
title: "This Week In React #221: State of React, React Router, Rsbuild, ProseMirror, Redux, React Hook Form, Base UI, RSC, React Admin | AI & RN, Expo, Strict DOM, Polygen, Ignite, New Arch, Radon, macOS, Universal RSC, Gesture Handler | TypeScript, Prettier, esbuild..."

date: 02-12-2025

segments.source_content: The results of State of React 2024 are out. It is a gold mine of information and we canâ€™t possibly talk about everything here but here are a few highlights:

translations.fr: Les rÃ©sultats du State of React 2024 sont disponibles. C'est une mine d'informations et nous ne pouvons pas tout aborder ici, mais voici quelques points marquants :
translations.en: Les rÃ©sultats du State of React 2024 sont disponibles. C'est une mine d'informations et nous ne pouvons pas tout aborder ici, mais voici quelques points marquants :

segments.source_content:
- Of the â€œnewâ€ React features, Server Components are the most popular with 40% of the ~7000 respondents having â€œused itâ€, probably thanks to Next.jsâ€¦
- `forwardRef` is the most disliked React API, and is going away!
- Have you heard about Reactâ€™s Taint API? It looks like 80% of React devs have not, which is understandable since itâ€™s experimental.
- Thereâ€™s not that much movement in the \#1 spot: Next.js, TanStack Query, Axios, Jest, and Zod are still the most frequently used.
- A few rising stars: Zustand and Vitest got more users, TanStack Start is \#1 in interest even though almost no one has used it yet.

translations.fr:
- Parmi les nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s de React, les Server Components sont les plus populaires avec 40% des ~7000 rÃ©pondants les ayant "utilisÃ©es", probablement grÃ¢ce Ã  Next.jsâ€¦
- `forwardRef` est l'API React la moins apprÃ©ciÃ©e, et elle va disparaÃ®tre !
- Avez-vous entendu parler de l'API Taint de React ? Il semble que 80% des dÃ©veloppeurs React ne la connaissent pas, ce qui est comprÃ©hensible car elle est expÃ©rimentale.
- Peu de changement en premiÃ¨re position : Next.js, TanStack Query, Axios, Jest et Zod restent les plus utilisÃ©s.
- Quelques Ã©toiles montantes : Zustand et Vitest ont gagnÃ© des utilisateurs, TanStack Start est \#1 en intÃ©rÃªt bien que presque personne ne l'ait encore utilisÃ©.
translations.en:
- Parmi les nouvelles fonctionnalitÃ©s de React, les Server Components sont les plus populaires avec 40% des ~7000 rÃ©pondants les ayant "utilisÃ©es", probablement grÃ¢ce Ã  Next.js...
- `forwardRef` est l'API React la plus dÃ©testÃ©e, et elle va disparaÃ®tre !
- Avez-vous entendu parler de l'API Taint de React ? Il semble que 80% des dÃ©veloppeurs React n'en ont pas entendu parler, ce qui est comprÃ©hensible puisqu'elle est expÃ©rimentale.
- Il n'y a pas beaucoup de changement Ã  la premiÃ¨re place : Next.js, TanStack Query, Axios, Jest et Zod restent les plus utilisÃ©s.
- Quelques Ã©toiles montantes : Zustand et Vitest ont gagnÃ© des utilisateurs, TanStack Start est \#1 en termes d'intÃ©rÃªt bien que presque personne ne l'ait encore utilisÃ©.

This is a deep dive on the issues it caused, and the solution: using React directly instead of trying to â€œbridge the gapâ€.
- ğŸ“œ [Promises across the void: Streaming data with RSC](https://edspencer.net/2024/7/12/promises-across-the-void-react-server-components): React can send not-yet resolved promises from the server and finish awaiting them on the client. This article from a few months ago explains how this works.
- ğŸ“œ [What Do We Do with You, Old React?](https://www.manuelsanchezdev.com/blog/what-to-do-with-old-react-upgrading-to-modern-react): Tips on upgrading codebases that still use class components and â€œoldâ€ Redux.
- ğŸ“œ [We Replaced Our React Frontend with Go and WebAssembly](https://dagger.io/blog/replaced-react-with-go): They explain why this was the right choice for them, but probably donâ€™t do this at home.
- ğŸ“œ [Handling Relationships in React Admin](https://marmelab.com/blog/2025/02/06/handling-relationships-in-react-admin.html): The included components (`<ReferenceField>` and its friends) usually do what you need, but this also explains how to build custom ones.
- ğŸ“œ [Create React App Officially Deprecated Amid React 19 Compatibility Issues](https://socket.dev/blog/create-react-app-officially-deprecated?utm_medium=feed): If youâ€™ve not heard about this, catch up with this recap.

- ğŸ“œ [Master Redux Action Best Practices & Make Debugging Easy](https://janhesters.com/blog/master-redux-action-best-practices-and-make-debugging-easy)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Hook Form resolvers 4.0](https://github.com/react-hook-form/resolvers/releases/tag/v4.0.0): Adds a [standard-schema](https://github.com/standard-schema/standard-schema) resolver, so you can switch easily between validation libraries that conform to the standard-schema specification.
- ğŸ“¦ [Base UI v1.0.0 alpha 6](https://github.com/mui/base-ui/releases/tag/v1.0.0-alpha.6): This eagerly awaited collection of unstyled components is making its way through the alpha phase
- ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington \- Proof That React With RSCs is 2X Faster\!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AJvbnNFHx0A)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [Rocket Ship 60 \- Module Federation, RSCs & Universal Apps with Jack Herrington](https://share.transistor.fm/s/144c4947)

segments.source_content: Deploying Next.js apps on Vercel is easy, but optimizing hosting costs? Thatâ€™s a different story.

translations.fr: DÃ©ployer des applications Next.js sur Vercel est simple, mais optimiser les coÃ»ts d'hÃ©bergement ? C'est une autre histoire.
translations.en: DÃ©ployer des applications Next.js sur Vercel est simple, mais optimiser les coÃ»ts d'hÃ©bergement ? C'est une autre histoire.

segments.source_content: Join Chris Lojniewski and Jakub Dakowicz of Pagepro on **February 20th, 11 AM EST** for a deep analysis of Vercel cost optimization strategies. Learn how to identify what drives your costs and reduce them with **code-level optimizations** like adjusting prefetching to avoid excessive function calls, choosing proper rendering methods, and trimming unnecessary data transfers.

translations.fr: Rejoignez Chris Lojniewski et Jakub Dakowicz de Pagepro le **20 fÃ©vrier Ã  11h EST** pour une analyse approfondie des stratÃ©gies d'optimisation des coÃ»ts Vercel. DÃ©couvrez comment identifier les facteurs de coÃ»ts et les rÃ©duire grÃ¢ce Ã  des **optimisations au niveau du code** comme ajuster le prÃ©chargement pour Ã©viter les appels de fonction excessifs, choisir des mÃ©thodes de rendu appropriÃ©es et rÃ©duire les transferts de donnÃ©es inutiles.
translations.en: Rejoignez Chris Lojniewski et Jakub Dakowicz de Pagepro le **20 fÃ©vrier Ã  11h EST** pour une analyse approfondie des stratÃ©gies d'optimisation des coÃ»ts Vercel. Apprenez Ã  identifier ce qui gÃ©nÃ¨re vos coÃ»ts et Ã  les rÃ©duire grÃ¢ce Ã  des **optimisations au niveau du code** comme ajuster le prÃ©chargement pour Ã©viter les appels de fonction excessifs, choisir les mÃ©thodes de rendu appropriÃ©es et rÃ©duire les transferts de donnÃ©es inutiles.

segments.source_content: Theyâ€™ll also show you how to **minimize reliance on Vercelâ€™s premium features** with feature externalization - offloading analytics, image optimization, and password protection. Plus, theyâ€™ll break down when enterprise pricing is worth considering and when youâ€™re better off with alternatives. **Stop overpaying, and [register today](https://pagepro.co/nextjs-hosting-cost-optimization?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-expert-session&utm_id=this-week-in-react)**.

translations.fr: Ils vous montreront Ã©galement comment **minimiser la dÃ©pendance aux fonctionnalitÃ©s premium de Vercel** par l'externalisation des fonctionnalitÃ©s - dÃ©lÃ©guer l'analyse, l'optimisation d'images et la protection par mot de passe. De plus, ils expliqueront quand le tarif entreprise mÃ©rite d'Ãªtre envisagÃ© et quand il vaut mieux se tourner vers des alternatives. **ArrÃªtez de payer trop cher et [inscrivez-vous dÃ¨s aujourd'hui](https://pagepro.co/nextjs-hosting-cost-optimization?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-expert-session&utm_id=this-week-in-react)**.
translations.en: Ils vous montreront Ã©galement comment **minimiser la dÃ©pendance aux fonctionnalitÃ©s premium de Vercel** par l'externalisation de fonctionnalitÃ©s - dÃ©lÃ©guer l'analytique, l'optimisation d'images et la protection par mot de passe. De plus, ils expliqueront quand le tarif entreprise mÃ©rite d'Ãªtre envisagÃ© et quand il vaut mieux opter pour des alternatives. **ArrÃªtez de payer trop cher et [inscrivez-vous dÃ¨s aujourd'hui](https://pagepro.co/nextjs-hosting-cost-optimization?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=this-week-in-react-expert-session&utm_id=this-week-in-react)**.

segments.source_content: **Building apps with AI**

translations.fr: **Construire des applications avec l'IA**
translations.en: **Construire des applications avec l'IA**

segments.source_content: We don't talk too much about LLMs in this newsletter (we guess you already hear about it more than enough ğŸ˜…) but with all the announcements this week we thought it was a good time to give you an update.

translations.fr: Nous ne parlons pas trop des LLM dans cette newsletter (nous supposons que vous en entendez dÃ©jÃ  suffisamment ğŸ˜…) mais avec toutes les annonces cette semaine, nous avons pensÃ© que c'Ã©tait le bon moment pour vous donner des nouvelles.
translations.en: Nous ne parlons pas trop des LLM dans cette newsletter (nous supposons que vous en entendez dÃ©jÃ  suffisamment ğŸ˜…) mais avec toutes les annonces cette semaine, nous avons pensÃ© que c'Ã©tait le bon moment pour vous donner des nouvelles.

segments.source_content: The big news: **[Bolt and Expo have partnered](https://expo.dev/blog/bolt-expo-integration-announcement)** to add (React-)Native mobile apps support to Bolt. Right now you can preview your AI-generated apps on the web, but you need to download the code to go further. They plan to add an integration with EAS to deploy to production in the future.

translations.fr: La grande nouvelle : **[Bolt et Expo ont conclu un partenariat](https://expo.dev/blog/bolt-expo-integration-announcement)** pour ajouter la prise en charge des applications mobiles (React-)Native Ã  Bolt. Actuellement, vous pouvez prÃ©visualiser vos applications gÃ©nÃ©rÃ©es par IA sur le web, mais vous devez tÃ©lÃ©charger le code pour aller plus loin. Ils prÃ©voient d'ajouter une intÃ©gration avec EAS pour dÃ©ployer en production Ã  l'avenir.
translations.en: La grande nouvelle : **[Bolt et Expo se sont associÃ©s](https://expo.dev/blog/bolt-expo-integration-announcement)** pour ajouter la prise en charge des applications mobiles (React-)Native Ã  Bolt. Actuellement, vous pouvez prÃ©visualiser vos applications gÃ©nÃ©rÃ©es par IA sur le web, mais vous devez tÃ©lÃ©charger le code pour aller plus loin. Ils prÃ©voient d'ajouter une intÃ©gration avec EAS pour dÃ©ployer en production Ã  l'avenir.

segments.source_content: Some competitors also had things to announce:

translations.fr: Quelques concurrents avaient Ã©galement des annonces Ã  faire :
translations.en: Certains concurrents avaient Ã©galement des annonces Ã  faire :

segments.source_content:
- There's now an official Expo template in Replit, and [a demo video you can watch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTm_dCF53qk). Replit has an app, so you can build apps from an app.
- A startup called a0 [launched a v0-like service](https://a0.dev) to generate RN apps.

translations.fr:
- Il existe dÃ©sormais un modÃ¨le Expo officiel dans Replit, et [une vidÃ©o de dÃ©monstration Ã  regarder](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTm_dCF53qk). Replit dispose d'une application, vous pouvez donc crÃ©er des applications depuis une application.
- Une startup appelÃ©e a0 a [lancÃ© un service similaire Ã  v0](https://a0.dev) pour gÃ©nÃ©rer des applications RN.
translations.en:
- Il existe dÃ©sormais un modÃ¨le Expo officiel dans Replit, et [une vidÃ©o de dÃ©monstration Ã  regarder](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTm_dCF53qk). Replit a une application, donc vous pouvez crÃ©er des applications depuis une application.
- Une startup appelÃ©e a0 [a lancÃ© un service similaire Ã  v0](https://a0.dev) pour gÃ©nÃ©rer des applications RN.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Codemagic - a great App Center alternative for React Native devs! 8x faster builds, CodePush, automated distribution. 1-month free trial!](https://codemagic.io/migration-from-app-center/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=app_center_this_week_react)
- ğŸ¦ [This is not React Native](https://x.com/mrousavy/status/1889358737930068051): Mark is working on a new UI library based based React, JSI and NitroModules but **without** React Native. It uses SwiftUI and Compose under the hood.
- ğŸ¦ [DeepSeek R1 running locally in a React App:](https://x.com/SzymonRybczak/status/1889412928694002004) The repo is open-sourced [here](https://github.com/callstackincubator/ai). Please note that it is highly experimental and may add up to 1GB to your app.
- ğŸ‘€ [Expo Universal React Server Components + AI chat app demo](https://github.com/EvanBacon/expo-ai): Evan Bacon just open-sourced the app he demoed on various conf talks.
- ğŸ’¬ [React Strict DOM - Production readiness and adoption](https://github.com/facebook/react-strict-dom/discussions/270): Nicolas Gallagher shared an interesting update, mentioning RSD is used in production by Meta.
- ğŸ—“ [React Universe Conf](https://www.reactuniverseconf.com/?utm_campaign=RUC2025&utm_source=TWIRpartnership&utm_content=savethedate) \- ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± WrocÅ‚aw - 2-4 September. Call for Papers is now open! Get a 10% discount with code "TWIR".
- ğŸ“œ [Bringing WebAssembly to React Native With Polygen](https://www.callstack.com/blog/bringing-webassembly-to-react-native-with-polygen): Polygen allows WebAssembly to run in React Native with near-native performance by compiling modules to native code, overcoming iOS JIT restrictions. This is a novel approach compared to existing solutions like react-native-webassembly, which relied on Wasm interpretation.
- ğŸ“œ [Increase your Expo-nent power with Ignite Generators](https://expo.dev/blog/increase-your-expo-power-with-ignite-generators): Ignite is a well known React Native app boilerplate, but it can be leveraged as a generator in any React Native project, including Expo apps, to automate the creation of screens, components, and state slices.
- ğŸ“œ [How does React Native's New Architecture affect performance?](https://dev.to/anishamalde/how-does-react-natives-new-architecture-affect-performance-1dkf): Anisha conducted a benchmark revealing performance improvements of up to 1000ms when enabling the New Architecture for a React Native TV app, where performance is crucial.
- ğŸ“œ [Bridgeless Native Development](https://www.callstack.com/blog/bridgeless-native-development): Short summary of the methods used over the years to bridge native code (NativeModule, TurboModule, NitroModule).
- ğŸ“œ [How to Profile Native Code in React Native Using Tracy](https://www.callstack.com/blog/how-to-profile-native-code-react-native-with-tracy)
- ğŸ“œ [How to build a live activity with Expo, SwiftUI and React Native](https://christopher.engineering/en/blog/live-activity-with-react-native/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Radon IDE v1.3](https://github.com/software-mansion/radon-ide/releases/tag/v1.3.0): built-in Network Inspector, Redux DevTools support, debugger improvements.
- ğŸ“¦ [React Native Gesture Handler v2.23](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-gesture-handler/releases/tag/2.23.0): The old API will be deprecated.
- ğŸ“¦ [React Native macOS v0.77](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-macos/releases/tag/react-native-macos%400.77.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Native Reanimated Carousel v4.0](https://rn-carousel.dev/migration-v4): Container Styling, Minimum Scroll Distance, Fixed Direction Scrolling, Progress Change Handling, Enhanced Pagination Components, Improved Web Support.
- ğŸ™ï¸ [RNR 321 \- Expo DOM with Evan Bacon](https://www.reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-321-expo-dom-with-evan-bacon)
